newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: UK minister holds talks with Bangladesh leaders.
newsitem.headline: UK minister holds talks with Bangladesh leaders.

text.p: British Under-Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs Liam Fox on Wednesday held talks with Bangladesh leaders to promote relations and boost trade, government officials said.
Fox, who arrived here on Tuesday on a four-day visit, met Commerce and Industry Minister Tofael Ahmed and discussed ways to increase the volume of bilateral trade and investment in Bangladesh.
Fox also met parliament speaker Humayun Rashid Chowdhury, Home Minister Rafiqul Islam and State Minister for Foreign Affairs Abul Hasan Chowdhury. They discussed bilateral issues, the officials said.

"My visit aims to boost British trade and investment in Bangladesh," Fox told reporters when he arrived on Tuesday. "I have come here to know the new government and see what we can do to help the democratic process in Bangladesh."
Two-way annual trade is worth around $400 million. Some 45 British companies have roughly $234 million investments in Bangladesh, according to official figures.
